poem:
Title: On Uncertain Promises

In the grey dominion of politics,
Promises unfold, nebulous as fog,
A gossamer pledge, spun in shadow.
Labour stands, shelled in ambiguity,
No clarity blooms in their edict.
Childcare hours, the fragile fragments
Of time, of toil, a gift or guile?
Yet silence hangs, unanswered, 
In the cold, indifferent air,
A question echoing, echoing,
In the evanescent tranquillity,
Of a morning's uncommitted whisper.
